result.execSummary:
The defendant Felton Harris Dodd Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order Amending Judgment Of Conviction - the judgment of conviction shall be amended by removing the language "No good time credit to be earned" from the imposed and stayed House of Correction term. - signed by the Court and filed.  Copies mailed to the parties.
Clerk:  jms
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. mag
Defendant's Motion to Modify Illegal Sentence
2/5/16 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Felton Harris Dodd in court with Attorney Matt Ricci.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the State, Defense counsel and defendant.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Court sentenced defendant to serve  12  MONTHS in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT time, credit for 8 days served. No good time credit to be earned.

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for  2  YEARS with the following conditions:
- Serve  90  days in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence with release for work.  Condition time to commence no later than 5:00 p.m. on 02-04-2016.
- AODA assessment and any treatment.
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- Full-time employment or a combination of part-time employment and school or full-time school
- Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- No firearms
- Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so)

Appeal rights given.  Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.

Sentencing hearing at 01-28-2016 01:30 pm
Justice Point Violation Report, filed. Court takes no action.
Justice Point Violation Report, filed Court takes no action.

Defendant Felton Harris Dodd in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms and body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.

Defendant Felton Harris Dodd in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Ronald Dague for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM023010  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/04/2015
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT BE KEPT SEPARATE FROM DEFENDANT DIONTE NOWELLS WHILE IN CUSTODY.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Felton Harris Dodd in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Felton Harris Dodd in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
